sentences.english: We are gonna publish their ugly faces.
sentences.chinese: 我们要把他们的丑恶嘴脸公布于众。

sentences.english: This is the history of the common features of Rigoletto.
sentences.chinese: 这是历代弄臣的共同嘴脸。

sentences.english: The science has caught up and the shamans are exposed.
sentences.chinese: 科学已经迎头赶上，巫师的丑恶嘴脸终被曝光。

sentences.english: Not all investors are like that.
sentences.chinese: 当然，并非所有投资者都是这副嘴脸。

sentences.english: That is trivial looks penurious of looking at be pressed by his under dictate woman.
sentences.chinese: 那猥琐的嘴脸，贪婪的看着被他手下压着得女子。

sentences.english: His servile expression of praise for his employer was disgusting to me.
sentences.chinese: 他奉承雇主的那副卑屈的嘴脸令我恶心。

sentences.english: It's because we Russians saw the ugly face of the West.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为我们俄罗斯人看到西方的丑恶嘴脸。

sentences.english: I remember his fatuous and limited face on the field of Austerlitz.
sentences.chinese: 我记得那副在奥斯特利茨战场的自鸣得意的嘴脸。

definition: lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
way of doing sth/behavior/to act in an affected manner/mannerism/gestures in opera
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
